title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 374-1.6 - Recyclable materials utilized for precious metal recovery
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 374-1.6 - Recyclable materials utilized for precious metal recovery

State Regulations
(a) Applicability and
requirements. (1)

The regulations of
this section apply to hazardous wastes that are reclaimed to recover
economically significant amounts of gold, silver, platinum, palladium, iridium, osmium, rhodium, ruthenium, or any combination of these. These hazardous wastes
will be referred to throughout this section as recyclable materials. (2)

Persons who generate, transport or store
recyclable materials that are regulated under this section are subject to the
following requirements: (i) notification
requirements under Part 372 of this Title; (ii)
section
372.2
(b) (for
generators), section
372.3
(for transporters), and
section
373-3.5
(b) (for
persons who store) of this Title; and
(iii)
for precious metals exported to or
imported from designated OECD member countries for recovery, section
372.5
(h) of this

Title. For precious metals exported to or imported from non-OECD countries for
recovery, section
372.5
of this

Title. (3)

Persons who
store recyclable materials that are regulated under this section must keep the
following records to document that they are not accumulating these materials
speculatively (as defined in section
371.1
[a]
of this

Title): (i) the volume of recyclable
materials stored at the beginning of the calendar year; (ii)
the amount of recyclable materials
generated or received during the calendar year; and
(iii)
the amount of recyclable materials
remaining at the end of the calendar year. (4)

Recyclable materials regulated under this
section that are accumulated speculatively (as defined in section
371.1
[a]
of this

Title) are subject to all applicable provisions of Parts 372 and 373 of this

Title. Notes
